title: Can we stop treating normals like a joke?
body:
I'm tired of having to play ranked to get a game where people play League properly. The objective of the game is to destroy the enemy Nexus. Just because it's normals doesn't mean that you're allowed to afk in the middle of the game because you don't feel like playing. Normals also doesn't mean that you can build AP on riven and feed 0-10.

Think about it. If you play basketball with your friends, you score on the opposing team's hoop because it's the proper way to play the game. You don't kick the ball 30 meters away from the court "just cuz it's a friendly match lelelele"

There is a difference between playing casually and TROLLING.

replies.body: You get people who play the game properly in ranked? You lucky dog you.

yes, i often see my teammates in their promos so i can expect them to not screw around

I don't play Normals to just AFK or feed, I play because I don't want to feel bad if I disconnect or do bad and not only get punished but have a bad score on my record. Until I'm able to play a match where I not only don't lag, but don't lag when a family member is watching a video or in the middle of the day I have a large "spike" then I will play Ranked. Until then, its a personal things many do. 

Right now, my main objective is to just get all the stupid champs. 79 so far, 47 to go. 

I also understand your point, exactly. I don't want someone to feed or just AFK but honestly, it happens, I get mad, I rage and it doesn't do much. I'd rather just forget about it, thank goodness I still get IP and move on.
"it's just norms" - every feeder ever
"Its just a game" - Every ranked feeder ever.

Trolling because "it's just normals" is lame as shit and ban-worthy. Not making an effort at winning is also not okay.

Trying new champions or things, or playing champions that you honestly feel are weak but you like playing them (I do this with Olaf) in normals is okay.

I'm just gonna put this out there. I don't normals as seriously as ranked. And since league is a videogame, it's entire purpose is to provide fun entertainment, in other words, _**to have fun**_. Don't get me wrong though, I do still try in normals, and 95% of the time I play things that make sense. But sometimes if my friends and I want to have fun and try something weird, I try weird shit like vi and sion in the bot lane. We do still try to do good, but playing those champions in the bot lane is not normal in the slightest, but it is fun as hell, which is all that really matters in a game. And I guess by using this logic, if straight up feeding is fun to some people, than they should do it. I'm not trying to justify that, because that's just being a dick. But if you just want to try something out that you think is fun and might work, then I think you should be able to do it in normals. Definitely not in ranked though, because ranked actually matters to the vast majority of players.
tl:dr Have fun and try new shit in normals, but don't be a dick by making it unreasonable. And don't fuck around in ranked.
While we're at it lets stop treating ranked like a joke.

Yes people should take Normals more seriously, but to all those people in Normals that say "Go play Co-Op" because you're learning a new champion, I say shut up. Bots aren't smart at all and are 100% predictable. Normals is for learning champions. Ranked is for using champions you've mastered. Bots is for getting free IP or bringing in a new friend who hasn't a clue what's going on. If you're raging at someone in Normals because they haven't mastered their new champion yet, then you're the problem. Help them out or just shut up.

B-But bots test your ability to go 30-0 and steamroll them!
I-I mean, B-bots = you know what you're doing!
It's weird that I find exponentially more trolls/feeders/incompetent players in Ranked than normals.

I agree with you so much. People need to stop thinking that normals is where they can troll and get away with it. You're being selfish when you waste 20 mins of everyone's time. 

Even when they're on the other team, it's not satisfying crushing an AD Leblanc running right down the middle of the lane. It's not fun when someone is texting their significant other in a bush while team fights are happening. Don't play team games if you're a selfish player. Just don't. If you think you need to have fun at other's expense then you need to play a different game. Stop putting your team at a severe disadvantage because that's what you consider to be "fun".

Not everyone plays ranked, and a lot of people do not like to play ranked. Some of us are getting our champion pools ready for ranked. Part of the reason I want to climb is because I get matched with bronze and silver players in my normals, and they always do some BS like Karthus ADC and Rek'Sai support.

I'm all for trying new off meta things, but so many people who think it's fun to do this have no understanding of the champion, when to pick them, or what off meta means.

Mostly I see people pretend like normals means there are no rules and the points don't matter.

Could we also stop treating normal draft like it's ranked?  I don't like having my head bit off every time I try a new champion against actual players, or try a champion in a different role than the "meta" considers it to be.
I've had the opposite. I rarely ever get feeders or trolls in normal games, but my ranked games.. Ugh.
For me, you can do whatever in normals, as long as you don't suck. Feeding is bad, but playing off meta is okay if you play well.

Here is the deal... I played before ranked existed, so to me Normals is just that, it's a normal game of league.  In a normal game of league, we'd get bored and play AD Soraka and AD Annie, with AP Nasus, Tank Katarina, and Jungle Teemo.  We also would actually try and win.  If we lost, we laughed it off, and moved on.  However, this was when we were a 5 man.  I think that it is perfectly fine to play an AP Riven, as long as you set her up to still be able to do her job (it's possible).  If she fails at killing, but is still bruising/harassing/initiating?  Let the player be.  They are doing their job, just poorly.  

HOWEVER, that being said... if they are just blatantly trolling, going AFK, or whining about 'Try Hards?'  They should be banned, or remanded to 50 bot games.  

Actually, I like the bot games idea... think I'll make a post.
what happened to, "it's just a game" ?

Actively trolling is an issue,  normals is where you are supposed to practice stuff right? So in theory there should be more people getting absolutely crushed in normals because they are playing things they don't know. So to some degree there will always be issues with normals having odd balance based on who is on their main vs someone learning and playing a champ for the first time.

If I play norms with my friends, I play it to win but I don't feel the stress and I can try new shit out. Going AP riven is dumb but I don't mind experimenting in norms. Unless you're afk or intentionally feeding, do what you feel like doing. There is nothing to really gain in normals apart from some IP so just have fun.

I get what you're talking about, but I'm not gonna take normals as seriously as ranked under any circumstance.  If you're mainly talking about trolls and feeders that use normals as a scapegoat, then I understand.  But the objective of normals is to have fun, not climb the ladder like in ranked.

it's a pvp game - why you shouldn't be doing your best is beyond me.

I mean, if you're trying to test a new build, jungling route or champion, it stands to reason that you should be trying your best. What kind of learing experience is it if you're not trying your best to begin with? You're not going to learn Azir by not giving a shit about how you play/build him.

I don't get pissed when you're 0-7-1 and legit trying your best to make whatever it is you're doing work. I get pissed when you're 0-7-1 because you're careless, not paying attention, and visibly not TRYING at all, and when you get called out on it, "it's normals chill".

There's a difference between taking a game seriously, and giving a game full effort.
I never said I don't try.  I said I don't take it as seriously.  I play normals for fun, or to play with friends I can't duo with.  But I always try to win in normals.

Where do people practice against real players then? Normal is where you try new things without jeopardizing anything.

Keep in mind, you're playing for 100ish IP and some experience points. If you lose, you still get some of those points.

Normal shouldn't be treated seriously.
You can train, but you can't just go "lol it's normals, who cares about effort"
In what world do you live in?  I find better players in normals then I do in ranked.

More like people need to stop taking normals so stupidly seriously. Want to practice some champs, try out new/strange/unusual builds, or just want to have fun? That's what norms are for. You don't lose anything for losing; you don't lose anything for doing badly. That's why many people play normals and don't give a shit if they lose

If you really wanted to tryhard balls deep or some shit, go play ranked (or 5s) and you would actually get something out of it.

It is excusable if someone goes 0/10 because they are practicing unfamiliar champs (because bots don't teach you anything about PVP btw). However, it is not excusable to go 0/10 because they ran into tower to feed, that's pretty much purposely trolling.

Bottom line, stop taking it so stupidly seriously. It's "casuals" for a reason.
If you're going to fuck around, take that shit to customs or Co-Op vs AI.
Can we stop tryharding and flaming anyone who does badly or doesn't follow the meta? At least in normals.
